result.execSummary:
The defendant Cheryl Denise Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
*Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges(including DNA), and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
*Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.

*Defendant is advised she is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised she is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
*NO CONTACT with the Kathryn R, and Ronald R.

*Attend and successfully complete cogitative Thinking programming.
*One Letter of Apology to the victims.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cheryl Denise Brown

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cheryl Denise Brown in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.   

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.
The court sentenced the defendant to serve 1 year in the House of Correction, with credit for 16 days time served. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 1 years.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Attend and successfully complete cogitative Thinking programming
-NO CONTACT with the Kathryn R, and Ronald R.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
-One Letter of Apology to the victims.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges(including DNA), and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.


RECEIVED & FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Ineligible voting Notice, Victim/witness services impact statments, Letters from victims.

Defendant Cheryl Denise Brown in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised she is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised she is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 10, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cheryl Denise Brown in court with attorney Calvin R Malone. Randy Sitzberger for James William Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AS. Case calendared for plea hearing. Defense requests new date. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 7.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 6, 2017 at 08:30 am.

16RM061951  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
11/22/16. er
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice 2000 for treatment referral.

Attorney Calvin R Malone in court, defendant Cheryl Denise Brown not in court, in custody.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Plea hearing scheduled for December 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.
The Court did not forfeit the signature bond upon issuance of warrant.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.

Defendant Cheryl Denise Brown in court with attorney Christian Eichenlaub for attorney Calvin R. Malone.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Malone had previously requested another date, as he was unavailable.  Parties had selected date.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Cheryl Denise Brown in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared on behalf of James W. Frisch for the State of Wisconsin.  Court canceled the stayed bench warrant as defendant appeared in court today.  Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Court granted same and ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This court received a telephone call from the defendant indicated she just started a job and was unable to appear on today's date and requested another court date either tomorrow or this week.  Defense counsel advised of same and was provided defendant's telephone number by this clerk.  Defense counsel advised the Court that he had in fact contacted his client and is requesting that the court issue but stay a warrant to a date later this week.  No objection by the State.  Court granted defense request and ordered a bench warrant issued but STAYED to the next court date.  File retained in court.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cheryl Denise Brown in court with attorney Mary Scholle for Calvin R. Malone.  Ronald Dague for James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 01-27-2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Cheryl Denise Brown
Current: 4435 West Capitol Drive, Milwaukee, WI 53216   (Effective: 01-07-2015)
Prior: 4435 West Capitol Drive, Milwaukee, WI 53216
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kathryn R. and Christine J. or their residence or place of employment

Defendant Cheryl Denise Brown in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 21.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1/7/15 @ 1:30 pm
